wikipedia_page.main: William Paull (c. 1872 – 5 February 1903) was a British baritone at the turn of the 20th century.  He was born in Cornwall, UK, in c. 1872. He had a wide repertoire ranging from opera and oratorio to the popular ballads of his day and was becoming well regarded as a soloist, when in 1903 at about the age of 30, his life was cut short by an accident whilst on tour in the USA.
